defs.docs: This crate provides traits for working with finite fields.

attributes.value: / This crate provides traits for working with finite fields.
no_std
deny(rustdoc :: broken_intra_doc_links)
forbid(unsafe_code)

defs.name: BatchInverter
defs.docs: A non-allocating batch inverter.

attributes.value: / A non-allocating batch inverter.

defs.name: invert_with_external_scratch
defs.value:
pub fn invert_with_external_scratch<F>(&mut [F], &mut [F]) -> F where
F: Field + ConstantTimeEq
defs.docs:
Inverts each field element in `elements` (when nonzero). Zero-valued elements are
 left as zero.

attributes.value: / Inverts each field element in `elements` (when nonzero). Zero-valued elements are
/ left as zero.
/ - `scratch_space` is a slice of field elements that can be freely overwritten.
/ Returns the inverse of the product of all nonzero field elements.
/ # Panics
/ This function will panic if `elements.len() != scratch_space.len()`.

defs.name: invert_with_internal_scratch
defs.value:
pub fn invert_with_internal_scratch<F, T, TE, TS>(&mut [T], TE, TS) -> F where
F: Field + ConstantTimeEq, TE: Fn(&mut T) -> &mut F, TS: Fn(&mut T) -> &mut F
defs.docs:
Inverts each field element in `items` (when nonzero). Zero-valued elements are
 left as zero.

attributes.value: / Inverts each field element in `items` (when nonzero). Zero-valued elements are
/ left as zero.
/ - `element` is a function that extracts the element to be inverted from `items`.
/ - `scratch_space` is a function that extracts the scratch space from `items`.
/ Returns the inverse of the product of all nonzero field elements.

Field: Sized + Eq + Copy + Clone + Default + Send + Sync + fmt::Debug + 'static +

Self> + Mul<Output = Self> + Neg<Output = Self> + for<'a> Add<&'a Self, Output
= Self> + for<'a> Mul<&'a Self, Output = Self> + for<'a> Sub<&'a Self, Output
= Self> + MulAssign + AddAssign + SubAssign + for<'a> MulAssign<&'a Self> +
for<'a> AddAssign<&'a Self> + for<'a> SubAssign<&'a Self>

defs.name: is_zero_vartime
defs.docs: Returns true iff this element is zero.

attributes.value: / Returns true iff this element is zero.
/ # Security
/ This method provides **no** constant-time guarantees. Implementors of the
/ `Field` trait **may** optimise this method using non-constant-time logic.

defs.name: pow_vartime
defs.value: pub fn pow_vartime<S: AsRef<[u64]>>(&Self, S) -> Self
defs.docs:
Exponentiates `self` by `exp`, where `exp` is a little-endian order
 integer exponent.

attributes.value: / Exponentiates `self` by `exp`, where `exp` is a little-endian order
/ integer exponent.
/ **This operation is variable time with respect to the exponent.** If the
/ exponent is fixed, this operation is effectively constant time.

defs.docs: This represents an element of a prime field.

attributes.value: / This represents an element of a prime field.

defs.value: type Repr: Copy + Default + Send + Sync + 'static + AsRef<[u8]> + AsMut<[u8]>;
defs.docs:
The prime field can be converted back and forth into this binary
 representation.

attributes.value: / The prime field can be converted back and forth into this binary
/ representation.

defs.name: from_str_vartime
defs.docs:
Interpret a string of numbers as a (congruent) prime field element.
 Does not accept unnecessary leading zeroes or a blank string.

attributes.value: / Interpret a string of numbers as a (congruent) prime field element.
/ Does not accept unnecessary leading zeroes or a blank string.
/ # Security
/ This method provides **no** constant-time guarantees.

defs.name: from_repr
defs.docs:
Attempts to convert a byte representation of a field element into an element of
 this prime field, failing if the input is not canonical (is not smaller than the
 field's modulus).

attributes.value: / Attempts to convert a byte representation of a field element into an element of
/ this prime field, failing if the input is not canonical (is not smaller than the
/ field's modulus).
/ The byte representation is interpreted with the same endianness as elements
/ returned by [`PrimeField::to_repr`].

defs.name: from_repr_vartime
defs.docs:
Attempts to convert a byte representation of a field element into an element of
 this prime field, failing if the input is not canonical (is not smaller than the
 field's modulus).

attributes.value: / Attempts to convert a byte representation of a field element into an element of
/ this prime field, failing if the input is not canonical (is not smaller than the
/ field's modulus).
/ The byte representation is interpreted with the same endianness as elements
/ returned by [`PrimeField::to_repr`].
/ # Security
/ This method provides **no** constant-time guarantees. Implementors of the
/ `PrimeField` trait **may** optimise this method using non-constant-time logic.

defs.name: to_repr
defs.docs:
Converts an element of the prime field into the standard byte representation for
 this field.

attributes.value: / Converts an element of the prime field into the standard byte representation for
/ this field.
/ The endianness of the byte representation is implementation-specific. Generic
/ encodings of field elements should be treated as opaque.

defs.name: is_odd
defs.docs: Returns true iff this element is odd.

attributes.value: / Returns true iff this element is odd.

defs.name: is_even
defs.docs: Returns true iff this element is even.

attributes.value: / Returns true iff this element is even.
inline(always)

defs.name: NUM_BITS
defs.docs: How many bits are needed to represent an element of this field.

attributes.value: / How many bits are needed to represent an element of this field.

defs.name: CAPACITY
defs.docs: How many bits of information can be reliably stored in the field element.

attributes.value: / How many bits of information can be reliably stored in the field element.
/ This is usually `Self::NUM_BITS - 1`.

defs.name: multiplicative_generator
defs.docs:
Returns a fixed multiplicative generator of `modulus - 1` order. This element must
 also be a quadratic nonresidue.

attributes.value: / Returns a fixed multiplicative generator of `modulus - 1` order. This element must
/ also be a quadratic nonresidue.
/ It can be calculated using [SageMath] as `GF(modulus).primitive_element()`.
/ Implementations of this method MUST ensure that this is the generator used to
/ derive `Self::root_of_unity`.
/ [SageMath]: https://www.sagemath.org/

defs.name: S
defs.docs: An integer `s` satisfying the equation `2^s * t = modulus - 1` with `t` odd.

attributes.value: / An integer `s` satisfying the equation `2^s * t = modulus - 1` with `t` odd.
/ This is the number of leading zero bits in the little-endian bit representation of
/ `modulus - 1`.

defs.name: root_of_unity
defs.docs: Returns the `2^s` root of unity.

attributes.value: / Returns the `2^s` root of unity.
/ It can be calculated by exponentiating `Self::multiplicative_generator` by `t`,
/ where `t = (modulus - 1) >> Self::S`.
